goal:
bThe purpose of AEA is to promote professional hearing care and to protect and defend its membersâ€™ professional and common interests.
The A.E.A. has established the following objectives in the general interest of the parties represented:
To be a recognised contact for the European, international and national authorities;
To promote and protect the rights and social interests of its members towards all public or private entities;
To promote relationships with partners for research and the resolution of problems of mutual interest;
To designate and appoint its own representatives or delegates to entities or commissions wherever such representation is requested or accepted;
To support harmonisation of the professional practice of the Hearing Aid Professional in Europe; In order to achieve these objectives, the A.E.A. may establish consulting relationships and collaboration relationships with European, international and national public or private organisations.
